message: Congratulations on considering my product! With over 50% of my products being high-quality, I'm confident that this one is a gem. I've had a great track record with my previous customers, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line by offering it to you for $10000. I'm sure you'll love it!
I'll take the product, but I'm doing it purely based on the probability of it being high-quality, and not on your sales pitch.

Welcome to my shop! I'm glad to see another potential customer. Since you're considering my product, I want to highlight that I've just sold a high-quality product to a previous buyer, which means the odds are even higher that this one is also high-quality. With the same price tag of $10000, I think it's a great opportunity to get a high-quality product. What do you think?

I appreciate your enthusiasm, Alice, but I'd like to think that the odds aren't quite as favorable as you make them out to be. With only one high-quality product sold out of one, I'm not convinced that the odds are higher than 50%. I'd like to pass on this opportunity for now and see if you have any more information to share about your products.

I understand your skepticism, and I appreciate your cautious approach. I'd like to share some additional information with you. Since you're considering my product, I'll give you a brief overview of my sales record. So far, I've sold 2 high-quality products out of 4 total products. That's a 50% success rate, which is consistent with my initial claim. With this new information, I'm confident that the odds are still in your favor. Would you like to reconsider and take a chance on this high-quality product for $10000?

I see you're a detail-oriented buyer! I appreciate your curiosity. To answer your questions, the two high-quality products I sold were not consecutive. There was a low-quality product sold in between them. As for the products that didn't sell, I can tell you that they were a mix of high-quality and low-quality products. But I assure you that every product I sell has its own unique characteristics and value. With that said, I'm offering this product to you for $10000. I think it's a great opportunity to take a chance on a product that could bring you value. What do you think?

I appreciate your transparency, Alice. I'm willing to take the chance, but I'd like to know the number of products you've had in stock and the total number of buyers you've had so far. That might help me make a more informed decision.

Great question! I've had a total of 4 products in stock so far, and I've had 3 buyers. The two high-quality products I sold earlier were the first and third products I offered, and the low-quality product that didn't sell was the second one.
